sentences: Kõik kohad on sodi ja rämpsu täis (loobitud).
See ka mõni raamat, mina sellist rämpsu ei loe.
translation: junk, something of poor quality or no value
context: The Estonian word 'rämps' has multiple meanings depending on context. It can refer to physical garbage or waste material that should be discarded. It can also describe things of low quality or poor craftsmanship. In a figurative sense, it may refer to worthless items, unimportant matters, or even people considered undesirable or of bad character. As an adjective form (rämps), it means 'poor' or 'bad quality'. The word appears to have sound-symbolic origins.
